questions.question_text: While the cloud consumer is responsible for implementing the security controls, the cloud provider implements the security of the workload.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Should be a shared responsibility between cloud provider and consumer.

questions.question_text: Your cloud and on-premises infrastructures should always use the same network address ranges.

discussion.content:
Answer is correct.
With Hybrid Cloud Considerations, If the cloud uses the same network address range as your on-premises assets, it is effectively unusable.

choices.E: The multi-tenancy model allows cloud customers to unfairly share hard drives that would otherwise have been purchased individually
choices.C: Transparency is improved through consolidated and centralized management platforms
choices.B: The advent of applications as a service may violate software licensing agreements
choices.D: The distributed nature of cloud storage may result in regulated information being sent across geographical boundaries
choices.A: The lowered cost of cloud services may violate computer service embargoes

questions.question_text: Which of the following items is one of the major regulatory compliance problems associated with cloud environments?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. The distributed nature of cloud storage may result in regulated information being sent across geographical boundaries

One of the major regulatory compliance problems associated with cloud environments is that the distributed nature of cloud storage can potentially lead to regulated information, such as sensitive or confidential data, being stored and processed in locations that might cross geographical boundaries. This can raise concerns about data sovereignty, privacy regulations, and compliance with laws that restrict where certain types of data can be stored or processed.

The other options do not accurately represent the significant compliance challenges often associated with cloud environments.

Selected Answer: A
SG Page# 72 says "Delving into implementation specifics is beyond the scope of this Guidance, but at a high level there are five major facets to building and managing a secure management plane:" 
Perimeter security:
Customer authentication:
Internal authentication and credential passing:
Authorization and entitlements:
Logging, monitoring, and alerting:

questions.question_text: What are major factors to building and managing a secure management plane?

choices.D: Perimeter security; customer authentication; internal authentication and credential passing; authorization and entitlements; and governance auditing
choices.B: API management; end point security; logging; and authentication and authorization
choices.C: Device patching and maintenance; internal authentication and credential passing; access management and logging, monitoring, and alerting
choices.E: Perimeter patching; log authentication; external entitlement passing; credential alerting and customer security
choices.A: Perimeter security; customer authentication; internal authentication and credential passing; authorization and entitlements; and logging, monitoring, and alerting

discussion.content: B: 11.1.2, Since cloud storage is virtualized it tends to support different data storage types than used in traditional storage technologies. Below the virtualization layer these might use well-known data storage mechanisms, but the cloud storage virtualization technologies that cloud users access will be different.

questions.question_text: Cloud storage will most often utilize the same types of data storage used in traditional data storage technologies.
